page.title: 03FARMING AROUND CRAWCROOK.
page.content: Farming in the area has made two major changes in the last thirty years. Nowadays the principal farming is for beef cattle, sheep, pigs and horses. The land is either used for intensive grazing, with hay harvesting, rough pasture and a small amount of root cropping and barley for animal winter feedstuffs. A small amount of rape is also grown. Thirty years ago most farms were mixed arable farms. Most changed to Dairy Farming during the 1950's. Changes in E.E.C. and M.M.B policies have rendered dairy farming in the area unprofitable and farmers have changed to stock rearing.
